text: Ellison Edwin Ketchum (July 22, 1908 – November 21, 1960) was an American football and basketball player, coach, and college athletics administrator. ==Biography== He was born on July 22, 1908 in Colorado Springs, Colorado. He was the head football coach at the University of Denver for one season, in 1942, compiling a record of 6–3–1. Ketchum served two stints as the head basketball coach at Denver, from 1940 to 1943 and from 1946 to 1948, amassing a record of 63–60. Ketchum was born in 1908 in Colorado Springs, Colorado. He graduated from the University of Denver, where he lettered in football and basketball, in 1930. Ketchum died of cancer on November 21, 1960 in Coral Gables, Florida. ==Head coaching record== ===Football=== ==References== ==External links== * Category:1908 births Category:1960 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball coaches from Colorado Category:Basketball players from Colorado Category:Deaths from cancer in Florida Category:Denver Pioneers athletic directors Category:Denver Pioneers football coaches Category:Denver Pioneers football players Category:Denver Pioneers men's basketball coaches Category:Denver Pioneers men's basketball players Category:Sportspeople from Colorado Springs, Colorado
title: Ellison Ketchum
